intro: Sisymbrium decipiens, commonly known as the deceptive crucifer, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbages and mustards. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. It typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas. Sisymbrium decipiens is an annual plant that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds.
